Original_notes: reverts to lineage head as personal property
hill village average over 100 but usually less than 500
plains villages retain dispersed settlement pattern but population usually exceeds 500
sealed small houses containing leopard and supposedly in some cases human skulls are present. Also sacred granaries. None of these structures are entered for ceremonies as far as I know
Some simple geometric designs made with finger on wet mud of external womanâ€™s house walls. A little red ochre painting. Decoration not general or extensive.
Not general but in at least one village, a traditional citadel still exists
Though chief has some priestly duties connected with earth ceremonies which he executes himself
A well developed native court system under official regulation now exists. I believe that the traditional judicial process was less formalized. Chief was not judging but rather leading arbitrator

(+); A single pre eminent divinity called Naan is translated as God, but it is not described or personified except in myths which the people say are "just stories". Prayers are directed to him but his manner of intervention in human affairs is not clear
This was done by near neighbors of the Kofyar
